text: This block returns “True” in case the last candle was black. You can place this block anywhere except for the first root block (Trade Parameters).
The term “Candle” or “Candlestick” is used to describe one bar on the Candlestick chart.
Each candlestick on the chart represents 4 market prices for the selected time interval:
- Open price: the opening price of a time interval.
- High price: the highest price during a time interval.
- Low price: the lowest price during a time interval.
- Close price: the closing price of a time interval.
Black (or Red) bar represents downward movement of the market price, i.e. open price is higher than close price.
White (or Green) bar represents upward movement of the market price, i.e. open price is lower than close price.
The time interval for each candle can be from 1 minute to 1 day. You can select it in the “Trade Parameters” root block.
